The distribution of $0.40 per share is payable to stockholders of record on . The company owns nearly 2 million acres of timberlands in Alabama, Arkansas, Idaho, Louisiana, Minnesota and Mississippi.
column4: Myers Industries, Inc. will report financial results for the fourth quarter and year ended on Tuesday, before the market opens. The Company will host a conference call the same day at 10 a.m. Eastern Time to review its performance.Investors and analysts may access the call at (833) 233-3452; international callers use (647) 689-4129.
column5: Applied Materials Inc. (AMAT) on Wednesday reported fiscal first-quarter earnings of $135 million. On a per-share basis, the Santaclara, California-based company said it had net income of 13 cents. The maker of chipmaking equipment posted revenue of $4.2 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. For the current quarter ending in May, Applied Materials expects its per- share earnings to range from $1.10-1.18
column6: Chili's is the latest restaurant chain to be affected by a data breach. The company is working with third-party forensic experts to determine how the breach occurred. So far, Brinker suspects malware was used to gather information including credit- and debit-card numbers as well as cardholder names from in-restaurant purchases.Shares of the company slipped as much as 2 percent on Monday.
column7: Lizzy Gurdus is a digital producer on CNBC's Mad Money with Jim Kramer. She attended the 2016 Business News Associate Workshop in Washington, D.C. Lizzy: "I've learned, grown, and flourished with CNBC, and I have the workshop to thank for that" The workshop will be held in Houston, Texas, on August 10. For more information, visit CNBC.com/Workshop.
column8: Trimble will hold a conference call on Monday, at 2 p.m. PT to review its first quarter 2018 results. The call will be broadcast live on the web at . Investors without Internet access may dial into the call at 800-528-9198 (U.S.) or 702-928-6633 (international). The passcode is 6279819.
column9: Lamb Weston is a leading supplier of frozen potato, sweet potato, appetizer and vegetable products to restaurants and retailers around the world. The dividend is payable on , to stockholders of record at the close of business on . For more than 60 years, Lamb Weston has led the industry in innovation, introducing inventive products that simplify back-of-house management for our customers.
column10: Alaska Air Group, Inc. will announce its fourth quarter and full year 2017 financial results on Thursday, Jan. 25, 2018. A conference call is scheduled at 8:30 a.m. Pacific time. Interested parties may listen to the call via webcast at Alaska Airlines, Virgin America and Horizon Air are subsidiaries of Alaska Air Group (NYSE: ALK)
column11: Aurora, a start-up developing self-driving cars, has closed out of its series A round of venture capital funding with a $90 million investment. The investment comes from Index Ventures and Greylock Partners. Reid Hoffman, the former founder of LinkedIn, and Mike Volpi, a partner at Index Ventures, will also join the Aurora board. Aurora is already working with Volkswagen , Hyundai and Byton, a Chinese automaker developing electric vehicles.
column12: CNBC sat down with the Dabrowskis to discuss how their start-up, known as Synthego, makes it easier for scientists to use tools like CRISPR to find cures for diseases in the next decade. "This, as a computer engineer, is like being, say, in the 1970's with computers, where everyone had mainframes and there were very few computer users," Paul Dabrowski said.
column13: Nuverra Environmental Solutions, Inc. will report fourth quarter 2017 results on Tuesday, . Mark D. Johnsrud, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, and Edward A. Lang, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, will host a conference call with investors at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time. The conference call may also be accessed by dialing 719-457-2628 conference ID 6970522.

The Company will conduct a conference call and webcast to discuss these results on at 10:00 am ET. Gold production guidance for 2018 is 230,000-255,000 ounces at a cash operating cost per ounce of $650-730. Golden Star is an established gold mining company that owns and operates the Wassa and Prestea mines in
column15: India is due to hold a national election in 2019 and there are several states electing new assemblies. "Abuse of social media including Facebook cannot be allowed to impact the fairness of elections," Ravi Shankar Prasad says. Facebook has said it has tightened its controls on such practices since it discovered the alleged abuses in 2015, but the issue has continued to rock some political parties across the world.
column16: Ecobee is a smart device manufacturer whose products are powered by Amazon Alexa. Its thermostats and lights switches are voice activated, so they can blend in with the home. Most of Ecobee's more than 1 million customers are ages 35 to 44. About one-fifth are 45 to 54, and the company is seeing adoption across all age ranges, including older users. The company plans to add other voice assistants at later dates.
column17: Model N Inc. (MODN) on Tuesday reported a loss of $3.9 million in its fiscal second quarter. The provider of revenue management services to the life science and technology industries posted revenue of $39.2 million in the period. For the current quarter ending in July, Model N expects its results to range from a lost of 11 cents to 9 cents per share. Model N shares have climbed 13 percent since the beginning of the year.
column18: Old Point Financial Corporation has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.11 per share on its common capital stock to be paid on . Based on the stock's closing price of $25.77 on , the dividend yield is approximately 1.7%. The dividend is consistent with the prior quarter's dividend. The company is the parent company of The Old Point National Bank of Phoebus, a locally owned and managed community bank based in Hampton,
column19: U.S. immigration authorities say they will resume accepting requests under a program that shields young people from deportation. A court order blocked a government decision to end the program in September. Congress is debating whether or not to write new legislation that would grant legal status to these immigrants that were brought to the U.S., as children and remain illegally. Former President Barack Obama enacted DACA to keep the undocumented immigrants, known as dreamers, from being deported.
column20: Aon's Board of Directors has authorized an 11% increase to its annual cash dividend paid quarterly on Aon's outstanding Class A Ordinary Shares. The dividend is payable to shareholders of record on . Aon is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics.
column21: Rwandan economy grew 6.1 percent last year, accelerating slightly from 5.9 percent in 2016. A good harvest of food crops last year helped the agricultural sector to expand by 7 percent from the previous year. There was also a surge in production of mining and quarrying products, especially coltan and cassiterite. The manufacturing sector too recorded healthy activity as output of cereals, textiles, clothes and leather products increased.
column22: CNBC's "Fast Money" traders share their first moves for the market open. Steve Grasso was a buyer of Horizons Life Sciences Marijuana Index ETF. David Seaburg has a financial interest in EDIT. Dan Nathan is long puts XLF. Guy Adami is long CELG, EXAS, GDX, INTC. Dan is short SMH. David Adami's wife, Linda Snow, works at Merck.
column23: Evolent Health, Inc. will release its fourth quarter and full year 2017 operating results on Tuesday, after market close. A conference call will follow at 5:30 p.m. Eastern Time. Shareholders and interested participants may listen to a live broadcast of the conference call by dialing 855.940.9467 or 412.317.6034 for international callers. A live webcast will be available on the investor relations section of Evolent
column24: Gold has tested key resistance of $1,375 per ounce. A break above that level would give gold a technically significant "higher high" Gold has already broken above its six-year trend line, going all the way back to 2011 highs. The yellow metal is up a little over 6 percent since mid-December, but it hasn't broken out of its consolidation pattern. Gold on Thursday was trading modestly higher.
column25: Monmouth Real Estate Investment Corporation (NYSE: MNR) announced the acquisition of a brand new 831,764 square foot industrial building located at 590 Northport Parkway, Savannah, GA. The property is net-leased for 10 years to Shaw Industries, Inc., a Georgia corporation. The Port of Savannah is the fourth largest port in the U.S. and is the fastest growing port in North America.
column26: RPC, Inc. will release its financial results for the first quarter ended on Wednesday, before the market opens. In conjunction with its earnings release, the Company will host a conference call to review the Company's financial and operating results. The conference call will be broadcast and archived for 90 days on the company's investor website at

Distributions are payable to shareholders on record as at . Since inception, Class A shareholders have received a total of $5.30 per share and Preferred shareholders have gotten a total. of $ 5.63 per share inclusive of this distribution.
column28: A blogger has reported that Paychex founder and chairman B. Thomas Golisano is "open" to a merger with the Buffalo, N.Y.-based M&T Bank. There is no foundation in fact in this blogger's article. Anything of this nature would go through official PaycheX channels as part of a comprehensive process that includes thorough review and consideration. This report is false.

The call can also be accessed live and on-demand from the Entegris website.
column30: Microsemi Corp. (MSCC) on Thursday reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $47.9 million. The maker of semiconductors for power management posted revenue of $468.7 million in the period. Microsemi expects its per-share earnings to range from 93 cents to $1.07 for the current quarter. The company expects revenue in the range of $477 million to $502 million for the fiscal second quarter.
column31: Kaiser Aluminum Corp. (KALU) on Wednesday reported first-quarter earnings of $25.7 million. On a per-share basis, the Foothill Ranch, California-based company said it had net income of $1.51. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $100.82, a rise of 20 percent in the last 12 months.
column32: Lands' End, Inc. (Nasdaq:LE) will host a conference call at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time on Thursday, , to discuss its fourth quarter and fiscal 2017 financial results. Listeners may access a live broadcast of the conference call on the Company's investor relations website: in the Events and Presentations section or by dialing (877) 280-2760.
column33: Facebook says Xiaomi will make the hardware for its Oculus Go virtual-reality headset. Xiaomi is also building a product called the Mi VR Standalone for the Chinese market. The partnership could help Facebook get its VR technology and Chinese versions of Oculus content into the world's largest consumer market. Facebook said at its Oculus Connect conference in October that it will begin shipping Go, the company's first standalone headset, in early 2018.
column34: Steven Silberstein has joined BlueVoyant as Chief Operating Officer. He previously served as CEO of Sheltered Harbor, a financial services industry initiative launched in 2016 to improve resiliency and protect consumer banking accounts. "Steve brings 30 years of financial sector experience, strengthening our already robust leadership team," said Bluevoyant CEO Jim Rosenthal. Before joining Shelter Harbor, Silberenstein served as Chief Technology Officer of SunGard, a leading fintech company.
column35: Federated makes available all of its annual report documents and provides access to its other SEC filings on its website. Shareholders may also receive a paper copy of Federated's Form 10-K, which includes audited financial statements, free of charge upon written request. With 108 funds and a variety of separately managed account options, Federated provides comprehensive investment management to more than 8,500 institutions and intermediaries.
column36: The leaders of France, Germany, Britain and the U.S. issued a joint statement on Thursday. They condemned a chemical attack on a Russian former double agent in England. Moscow has denied any responsibility for the attack on Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia. Britain has expelled 23 Russian diplomats, and Moscow is expected to retaliate. The four nations called on Russia to provide full and complete disclosure of its Novichok nerve agent program.
column37: The Klein Law Firm announces that a class action complaint has been filed on behalf of shareholders of Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: JNJ) who purchased shares between and . The action, which was filed in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey, alleges that the Company violated federal securities laws. Shareholders have until to petition the court for lead plaintiff status.
column38: Masimo Corp. (MASI) on Wednesday reported first-quarter profit of $45.6 million. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring gains, were 75 cents per share. The medical technology company posted revenue of $213 million in the period.Masimo expects full-year earnings in the range of $2.80 to $1.88 per share, with revenue in therange of $808 million to $818 million.
column39: The dividend will be paid on , to stockholders of record as of the close of business on . The Company currently has approximately 111.7 million shares of common stock outstanding. SM Energy is an independent energy company engaged in the acquisition, exploration, development, and production of crude oil, natural gas, and natural gas liquids in onshore North America.
column40: The party also re-elected his daughter, Marine Le Pen, to a new term as president at party congress where she was its only candidate for the post. The party expelled him in 2015 over anti-Semitic remarks but he kept the honorary position. Sunday's vote is a crushing blow for the 89-year-old, who founded the party in 1972 and was runner-up in the 2002 French presidential election.
column41: Standard Motor Products, Inc. announced today that its Board of Directors has approved an increase in its quarterly common stock dividend from nineteen cents per share to twenty-one cents pershare. The increase is payable on to stockholders of record on . The company cautions investors that any forward-looking statements made by the company, including those that may be made in this press release, are based on management's expectations at the time they are made.
column42: Citron Research's Andrew Left says investors are focusing too much on Square's bitcoin ambitions. Square began offering bitcoin trading in the first quarter but said it only netted revenue of $200,000 from the activity. Left has been more positive about Alibaba, which he calls a compelling growth story. "It's the tollbooth to the Chinese middle class," he told CNBC's " Fast Money"
column43: Hub International Limited (Hub) announced today that it has acquired the shares of GMS Insurance (SWO) Inc. (GMS Insurance) Terms of the acquisition were not disclosed. GMS insurance is an independent benefit consulting firm that services clients in Southwestern Ontario and the greater Toronto area. Hub International Limited is committed to growing organically and through acquisitions to expand its geographic footprint and strengthen industry and product expertise.
column44: Michael Horowitz, the department's inspector general, said in a statement his review will examine whether the FBI and Justice Department followed the proper procedures. Republican members of the U.S. House Intelligence Committee alleged that the FBI made serious missteps when it sought a warrant to monitor a former advisor to President Donald Trump 's 2016 campaign. The review will look at whether the Justice Department and FBI followed proper procedures when they applied for a warrant.
column45: Berkshire Hathaway more than doubled its stake in Teva, to 40 million shares, in the first three months of this year. The conglomerate also increased its stake on St. Louis-based agricultural product giant Monsanto. The changes are reflected in Berkshire's latest regulatory filing on Tuesday, but they only report holdings up to the end of March.Shares of Teva rose 3.3 percent in premarket trading Wednesday.
column46: The 2017 annual report is now available electronically at It provides comprehensive information on the company and its strategy, business, governance and financial performance. Shareholders may request a printed copy of the annual report via this link. It will be distributed when it becomes available later this month. ABB is a pioneering technology leader in electrification products, robotics and motion, industrial automation and power grids.
column47: Justices allow Arkansas to enforce abortion restrictions. Law says doctors who provide abortion pills must hold a contract with another physician who has admitting privileges at a hospital and who would agree to handle complications. Law is similar to a provision in Texas law that the Supreme Court struck down in 2016. The justices on Tuesday rejected an appeal from the Planned Parenthood affiliate in Arkansas that asked the court to review an appeals court ruling and reinstate a lower court order.
column48: Citi Research reiterated its buy rating for Amazon shares, predicting strong growth for its international businesses. Walmart announced plans last week to acquire an initial stake of about 77 percent in Flipkart, India's top e-commerce company, for $16 billion. "We believe the India e- commerce market will grow at a 21% CAGR over the next 10 years to $202bn," analyst Mark May said.
column49: Wixen Music Publishing Inc is seeking damages worth at least $1.6 billion. Spotify failed to get a direct or a compulsory license from Wixen, the publisher says. Spotify declined to comment on the lawsuit. In May, the company agreed to pay more than $43 million to settle a proposed class action alleging it failed to pay royalties for some of the songs it makes available to users.
column50: The company will hold a conference call to discuss its financial results on Wednesday, January 31. The call will be available on the company's website at: For more information about the company, visit london.org or call 1-800-273-8255.
column51: Adverum Biotechnologies Inc. (ADVM) on Tuesday reported a loss of $14.8 million in its fourth quarter. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $56.1 million, or $1.29 per share. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $7.20, more than doubling in the last year.
column52: Canadian Pacific will release its first-quarter financial and operating results on . CP will discuss its results with the financial community in a conference call beginning at 4:30 p.m. eastern time. The conference call will be available by phone through to at 416-849-0833 or toll free 1-855-859-2056, password 1973958.
column53: Sessions insists he will "continue to discharge my duties with integrity and honor" President Donald Trump used the word "disgraceful" to describe how Sessions is handling Republican complaints about the FBI. Sessions suggested that the Justice Department's inspector general will evaluate whether prosecutors and FBI agents wrongly obtained a warrant to monitor the communications of a onetime Trump campaign associate. It's not the first time Trump has aired his gripes against Sessions over the Russia probe.
column54: Qualcomm said it had a "constructive" meeting with Broadcom on Feb. 14, the first time the two companies met to discuss the existing $121 billion offer. Qualcomm's board maintained its view that the proposal materially undervalues the chipmaker. Qualcomm again said Broadcom's promised breakup fee of $8 billion in the event regulators thwart the deal did not come close to compensating for risks related to the deal.
column55: Purcell Julie & Lefkowitz LLP is investigating a potential breach of fiduciary duty claim involving the board of directors of Abeona Therapeutics Inc. (NASDAQ: ABEO) If you are a shareholder and are interested in obtaining additional information regarding this investigation, please visit us at: may also contact Robert H. LefKowitz, Esq. either via email
column56: "Fortnite" is generating hundreds of millions of dollars each month in revenue. In-game purchases allow players to buy upgraded skins for their characters. Epic Games recently announced that it will be funding $100 million in esports prize pools for "Fortnites" The game is free to play and is expected to generate $3.5 billion in revenue this year alone, according to SuperData.
column57: Apollo's interest in Xerox has been reinforced by the appointment of John Visentin as the company's new CEO. There is no certainty that Apollo's approach will entice Xerox or that it will lead to a deal. Fujifilm has said it will challenge a court order suspending its deal with Xerox. Apollo declined to comment, while Xerox and Fujiflm did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
column58: Intuit Inc. (INTU) on Tuesday reported fiscal third-quarter net income of $1.2 billion. On a per-share basis, the Mountain View, California-based company said it had profit of $4.59. The maker of TurboTax, QuickBooks and other accounting software posted revenue of $2.93 billion. For the current quarter ending in July, Intuit expects its per- share earnings to range from 22 cents to 24 cents.
column59: Orchids Paper Products Company appoints Mindy Bartel as Chief Financial Officer. Ms. Bartel has over 25 years of experience in manufacturing and technology service industries. Orchids produces a full line of tissue products, including paper towels, bathroom tissue and paper napkins, to serve the value through ultra-premium quality market segments. The Company provides these products primarily to retail chains throughout the United States.
column60: UnitedHealth Group (NYSE: UNH) announced today that its Board of Directors at its regular quarterly meeting, authorized payment of a cash dividend of $0.75 per share. The dividend will be paid on , to all shareholders of record as of the close of business on . UnitedHealth Group is a diversified health and well-being company dedicated to helping people live healthier lives and making health care work better for everyone.

I do prefer Idexx Labs . It's got much more consistency" Lumentum Holdings Inc : "Optics are too hard for me. I'm going to have to say take a pass"

column63: Global debt levels soared to a record high of $233 trillion in the third quarter of 2017, the Institute of International Finance (IIF) said on Thursday. The Washington DC-based financial industry body said while total debt had risen by $16 trillion, debt ratio to global gross domestic product (GDP) had fallen for the fourth quarter in a row. However, China which has accounted for the lion's share of new debt in emerging markets, saw the pace of debt accumulation slow
column64: Apple is in talks to buy storage chips from Yangtze Memory Technologies. The move would mark the iPhone maker's first buy from a Chinese memory chipmaker. Apple will use these chips in new iPhone models and other products for sale in the Chinese domestic market specifically, the Nikkei reported, citing two people familiar with the matter. Both Apple and Yangtzes Memory did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
column65: Jason Industries, Inc. will release its fourth quarter 2017 results before the market opens on Thursday, . The Company will also hold a conference call to discuss the results at 10:00 am (Eastern Time) that day. The conference call can be accessed by dialing 1-877-451-6152 (domestic) or 1-201-389-0879 (international) A telephonic replay will be available approximately three hours after the call and can
column66: Sarah Huckabee Sanders is set to take reporters' questions Friday afternoon. The stream is slated to start at 2:45 p.m. ET. In a statement Friday afternoon, Sanders announced that Trump granted a full pardon to Scooter Libby. In 2007, Libby was convicted of lying to the FBI and obstructing justice. He was sentenced to 30 months in prison, but President George W. Bush commuted his sentence.
column67: Facebook is in the business of exploiting your data. Users are encouraged to like, share and comment their lives away in the name of staying connected to family and friends. As an ethical hacker, security researcher and data analyst , I know that there is a lot more to the story. The bedrock of modern democracy is at stake .More from The Conversation: Trust in digital technology will be the internet's next frontier.
column68: Tesla Chief Accounting Officer Eric Branderiz has left the company for personal reasons, according to an SEC filing published Thursday. He joined Tesla as chief accounting officer and corporate controller in 2016 while the company was in the midst of a controversial acquisition of SolarCity for $2.6 billion. "I've simply made a personal decision to leave and take some time off," he said in an e-mail to CNBC.
column69: Intercontinental Exchange announced Thursday it has an agreement to buy the Chicago Stock Exchange. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed, but The Wall Street Journal reported last week that the price being discussed was $70 million. Previously Chinese-led North America Casin Holdings tried to acquire the Chicago stock exchange. The deal collapsed in February after it was rejected by the Securities and Exchange Commission, according to Reuters.
column70: WildHorse Resource Development Corporation has declared an aggregate quarterly dividend of $6.756 million or $15.53 per share on its 435,000 shares of 6.0% Series A Perpetual Convertible Preferred Stock. WRD elected to pay the dividend in cash. The dividend is for the period beginning on to and was paid to holders of record on .
column71: Aerohive Networks Inc. (HIVE) on Thursday reported a loss of $3.4 million in its fourth quarter. On a per-share basis, the Milpitas, California-based company said it had a lost of 6 cents. For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $22.9 million, or 43 cents per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations.
column72: Boeing shares have rallied more than 100 percent in the past 12 months. CEO Dennis Muilenburg said he isn't surprised by the stock's rise. Muilenberg said the aerospace market as a whole "has changed" He said the industry has gone "from being a high-cycle business" to a "long-term sustained growth business" The higher stock price may reflect that Wall Street is now recognizing the shift, he said.
column73: American Equity Investment Life Holding Company will release first quarter 2018 earnings after the close of market on Wednesday, . The first quarter earnings release and financial supplement will be posted on the American Equity website at at that time. AEL will hold a conference call to discuss first quarter Earnings on Thursday, May 3, at 8:00 a.m. CT.

Insteel's products are sold primarily to manufacturers of concrete products that are used in nonresidential construction. The company's board of directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.03 per share on the Company's common stock payable on to shareholders of record as of .
column75: Raven Industries, Inc. announces a regular quarterly cash dividend of 13 cents per share. The dividend is payable , to shareholders of record on . Raven is a leader in precision agriculture, high-performance specialty films, and lighter-than-air technologies. Since 1956, Raven has designed, produced, and delivered exceptional solutions. For more information, visit
column76: CDW Corporation will host a webcast conference call to discuss its fourth quarter and full year 2017 results on Wednesday, at 8:30 a.m. ET. A live webcast (audio with slides) of the conference call will be accessible at investor.CDW.com. A taped replay of the webcast will be available on the website shortly after the call.
column77: Essential Products, founded by Android creator Andy Rubin, is exploring a potential sale, Bloomberg reports. The company has also cancelled the development of a new phone, the report says. Rubin co-founded Android before Google bought it in 2005, several years after he left the company. The appeal of Essential's first device was that it gave users a "pure" Android experience, meaning that it didn't come with a bunch of built-in apps.
column78: Pure Storage Inc. (PSTG) on Monday reported a loss of $64.3 million in its fiscal first quarter. On a per-share basis, the Mountain View, California-based company said it had a lost of 29 cents. For the current quarter ending in August, Pure Storage said it expects revenue in the range of $296 million to $304 million.Pure Storage shares have climbed 49 percent since the beginning of the year.
column79: A formal announcement by China's government could be made by the end of this year. In early 2016, Beijing relaxed restrictions on its one-child policy. The move helped push the number of births in the country to 17.86 million in 2016, an increase of 7.9 percent over 2015. The figure was the highest since 2000, according to China's National Bureau of Statistics. The country's birthrate has been declining rapidly since the 1980s.
column80: Investors are invited to dial into the conference call hosted by David J. LaRue, president and chief executive officer. A live webcast of the call will be available online through the Investors page of the company's website, Callers who pre-register will be given a unique PIN to gain immediate access to the call and bypass the live operator.
column81: Donald Savastano, 51, died Jan. 26 "after a recent diagnosis of stage 4 cancer," his obituary said. He bought a "Merry Millionaire" ticket on his way to his upstate New York home on Dec. 30. He elected to take the lump-sum payment of $661,800, the New York lottery said. "This is going change our lives," he told WABC-TV.
column82: China to inspect 84 Brazil meatpacking plants for export clearance. "The expectation is that the Asian country will open up a good part of these plants," the statement said. The statement did not specify what type of meat the plants process. The two countries hope to resolve many of the issues involved in Brazil's 102 complaints against China with the World Trade Organization, the statement added. It did not provide further details on the meeting.
column83: The Board of Directors has declared a first quarter cash dividend in the amount of $0.49 per share. The cash dividend represents a 7.2% increase over the cash dividend paid in the first quarter 2017. The declaration of dividend is payable to shareholders of record . This press release may contain forward looking statements as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.
column84: Barry Rosenstein is founder and managing partner of Jana Partners. The activist hedge fund manager was asked what he thought about recent comments from Appaloosa Management's David Tepper saying the market is "cheap" "We are more invested today than we've ever been," Rosenstein said Tuesday on CNBC's " Fast Money Halftime Report ." "It just seems like the market [rally] is going to continue for awhile," he added.
column85: President Donald Trump accuses special counsel Robert Mueller's team of "MEDDLING" in the upcoming midterm elections. Mueller is leading the probe into whether Russia interfered in the 2016 presidential election with help from Trump campaign aides. So far, four Trump associates have been charged in Mueller's investigation; three have pleaded guilty to lying to the authorities. Later Tuesday morning, Trump said he needed to focus more of his attention on issues important to Americans and less on the Russia investigation.
column86: Invitation Homes is a leading owner and operator of single-family homes for lease, offering residents high-quality homes across America. The company's mission, "Together with you, we make a house a home," reflects its commitment to high-touch service. The dividend will be paid on or before to stockholders of record of the Company's common stock as of the close of business on .
column87: A federal judge rejects a lawsuit by Massachusetts' attorney general. The lawsuit sought to block new rules by President Donald Trump's administration. The rules make it easier for employers to avoid providing insurance that covers birth control. Those rules, announced in October, remain on hold after two other federal judges issued preliminary injunctions blocking them from enforcing them. The judge said there is "no doubt" employers intend to take advantage of the exemptions.
column88: Quaker Chemical is a leading global provider of process fluids, chemical specialties, and technical expertise to a wide range of industries. For nearly 100 years, Quaker has helped customers around the world achieve production efficiency, improve product quality, and lower costs through a combination of innovative technology, process knowledge, and customized services. Quaker serves businesses worldwide with a network of dedicated and experienced professionals whose mission is to make a difference.
column89: Computer failure at Eurocontrol center in Brussels, Belgium. All the flight plans of journeys filed before 10.26 a.m. UTC had been lost. Backup plan will reduce the capacity of the European flight network by approximately 10 percent. Eurocontrol says there are no safety implications arising from the system failure. The system creates a flightpath for all journeys after airlines file flight plans. The problem has been identified and action is underway.
column90: A. O. Smith Corporation will release its fourth quarter 2017 financial results before the market opens on Tuesday, January 30. The company has scheduled an investor conference call to follow at 10:00 a.m. (Eastern Daylight Time) The call can be heard live on the company's web site, An audio replay of the call will be available on the web site after the live event.
column91: The Law Offices of Vincent Wong are investigating the Board of Directors of ZAIS Group Holdings, Inc. for possible breaches of fiduciary duty and other violations of state law. Under the terms of the deal, ZaIS shareholders will receive $4.10 for each ZA IS share they own. Vincent Wong, Esq. is an experienced attorney that has represented investors in securities litigations involving financial fraud and violations of shareholder rights.

column93: The Dixie Group will release its results for the year ended , before the market opens on . A listen-only Internet simulcast and replay of Dixie's conference call may be accessed with appropriate software on the Investor Relations page of the Company's website. An online replay of the call will be available approximately two hours following the conclusion of the live broadcast and will continue for 7 days.
column94: The French bulldog puppy was in a carrier that was sticking out into the aisle. A flight attendant told the passenger it would have to be moved, according to people familiar with the incident. "We take full responsibility and are deeply sorry for this tragic accident," a United spokesman says.Starting in April, the airline will issue brightly colored bag tags for in-cabin pet carriers, United says.
column95: Boston Scientific Corporation (NYSE: BSX) will webcast its conference call discussing financial results and business highlights for the first quarter ended on Wednesday, at 8:00 a.m. EDT. The call will be hosted by Mike Mahoney, chairman and chief executive officer, and Dan Brennan, executive vice president and chief financial officer. The company will issue a news release announcing financial results for thefirst quarter on Wednesday.
column96: AVX Corporation will release its preliminary quarterly and full year results for the period ended before the New York Stock Exchange opens on Wednesday, . The company will hold a conference call at 10:00 a.m. EST on that day. The conference call will be taped and available for replay until by dialing 855-859-2056 (404-537-3406 if calling from outside the U.S.
column97: Roy Sahachaisere, 48, was sentenced by U.S. District Judge Eric Vitaliano in Brooklyn. He was convicted of securities and wire fraud by a jury in November 2015. Seven other defendants had previously pleaded guilty, including Sandy Winick, a Canadian, who authorities said was the scheme's mastermind. The case followed one of the largest global penny stock probes ever by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
column98: A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday upheld a ruling that invalidated a crucial Johnson & Johnson patent on its blockbuster rheumatoid arthritis drug Remicade. The ruling limits J&J's ability to seek damages from Pfizer over its launch of a lower-cost version of the drug. Pfizer launched Inflectra in October 2016 after winning a set of rulings that invalidate J&j's patent. Ruling means Pfizer would be liable for money damages to
column99: The board of directors of Abbott declared a quarterly common dividend of 28 cents per share. This marks the 377 th consecutive quarterly dividend to be paid by Abbott since 1924. The cash dividend is payable , to shareholders of record at the close of business on . Abbott has increased its dividend payout for 46 consecutive years and is a member of the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats Index.
column100: CBRE Group Inc. (CBG) on Thursday reported fourth-quarter profit of $168.4 million. On a per-share basis, the Los Angeles-based company said it had net income of 49 cents. The results topped Wall Street expectations. CBRE shares have declined almost 2 percent since the beginning of the year, while the Standard & Poor's 500 index has stayed nearly flat.
